title: ChatGPT as proofer? Not here
description: Manton says he runs his posts through ChatGPT before publishing. I do it the other way, I use it for background info on the things I'm writing about as I write, more and more. I used to use Wikipedia that way. I would love to include links to some of my conversations, but I find their shared links are unreliable, I keep hearing from people who couldn't read them. Here's an experiment, two such backgrounders I had Claude.ai write for me for a pice I was writing (not published). Claude.ai on the future of Chrome re antitrust case Google lost. Claude.ai on claims Bluesky makes about being billionaire-proof. I wonder if people can read those.
excerpt: Dave Winer, OG blogger, podcaster, developed first apps in many categories. Old enough to know better. It's even worse than it appears.
